name: Roo.grid.PropertyGrid

config.name: listeners
autoSizeColumns
config.desc: True to automatically resize the columns to fit their content on initial render. It is more efficient to explicitly size the columns through the ColumnModel's {@link Roo.grid.ColumnModel#width} config option. Default is false.

config.name: customEditors
config.desc:
map of colnames=> custom editors.
the custom editor can be one of the standard ones (date|string|number|int|boolean), or a
grid editor eg. Roo.grid.GridEditor(new Roo.form.TextArea({selectOnFocus:true})),
false disables editing of the field.

config.name: maxRowsToMeasure
config.desc:
If autoSizeColumns is on, maxRowsToMeasure can be used to limit the number of
rows measured to get a columns size. Default is 0 (all rows).

config.name: minColumnWidth
config.desc: The minimum width a column can be resized to. Default is 25.

config.name: autoExpandColumn
config.desc: The id (or dataIndex) of a column in this grid that should expand to fill unused space. This id can not be 0. Default is false.

config.name: autoExpandMax
config.desc: The maximum width the autoExpandColumn can have (if enabled). Default is 1000.

config.name: enableRowHeightSync
config.desc: True to manually sync row heights across locked and not locked rows. Default is false.

config.name: propertyNames
config.desc: map of property Names to their displayed value

config.name: monitorWindowResize
config.desc: True to autoSize the grid when the window resizes. Default is true.

config.name: autoExpandMin
config.desc:
The minimum width the autoExpandColumn can have (if enabled).
Default is 50.

config.name: view
config.desc: The {@link Roo.grid.GridView} used by the grid. This can be set before a call to render().

config.name: autoWidth
config.desc:
True to set the grid's width to the default total width of the grid's columns instead
of a fixed width. Default is false.

config.name: ddGroup
config.desc: - drag drop group.

config.name: enableDrag
config.desc: True to enable drag of rows. Default is false. (double check if this is needed?)

config.name: maxHeight
config.desc: Sets the maximum height of the grid - ignored if autoHeight is not on.

config.name: trackMouseOver
config.desc: True to highlight rows when the mouse is over. Default is true.

config.name: loadMask
config.desc: An {@link Roo.LoadMask} config or true to mask the grid while loading. Default is false.

config.name: stripeRows
config.desc: True to stripe the rows.  Default is true.

config.name: enableColumnMove
config.desc: True to enable drag and drop reorder of columns. Default is true.

config.name: enableColumnHide
config.desc: True to enable hiding of columns with the header context menu. Default is true.

config.name: clicksToEdit
config.desc: The number of clicks on a cell required to display the cell's editor (defaults to 2)

config.name: autoSizeHeaders
config.desc: True to measure headers with column data when auto sizing columns. Default is true.

config.name: enableDragDrop
config.desc: True to enable drag and drop of rows. Default is false.

config.name: dropTarget
config.desc: An {@link Roo.dd.DropTarget} config

config.name: autoHeight
config.desc: True to fit the height of the grid container to the height of the data. Default is false.

methods.name: getSource
methods.desc: Gets all the data from the grid.

methods.name: setSource
methods.desc:
Sets the data for the Grid
accepts a Key => Value object of all the elements avaiable.

methods.name: stopEditing
methods.desc: Stops any active editing

methods.name: getDragDropText
methods.desc: Called to get grid's drag proxy text, by default returns this.ddText.

methods.name: startEditing
methods.desc: Starts editing the specified for the specified row/column

methods.name: getSelectionModel
methods.desc: Returns the grid's SelectionModel.

methods.name: destroy
methods.desc: Destroy this grid.

methods.name: getColumnModel
methods.desc: Returns the grid's ColumnModel.

methods.name: getGridEl
methods.desc: Returns the grid's underlying element.

methods.name: getDataSource
methods.desc: Returns the grid's DataSource.

methods.name: autoSize
methods.desc:
Causes the grid to manually recalculate its dimensions. Generally this is done automatically,
but if manual update is required this method will initiate it.

methods.name: getView
methods.desc: Returns the grid's GridView object.

methods.name: reconfigure
methods.desc:
Reconfigures the grid to use a different Store and Column Model.
The View will be bound to the new objects and refreshed.

methods.name: render
methods.desc: Called once after all setup has been completed and the grid is ready to be rendered.

methods.name: purgeListeners
methods.desc: Removes all listeners for this object

methods.name: on
methods.desc: Appends an event handler to this element (shorthand for addListener)

params.name: eventName
params.desc: The type of event to listen for

params.name: scope
params.desc:
(optional) The scope in which to execute the handler
function. The handler function's "this" context.

methods.name: un
methods.desc: Removes a listener (shorthand for removeListener)

params.name: eventName
params.desc: The type of event to listen for

params.name: scope
params.desc: (optional) The scope (this object) for the handler

methods.name: addEvents
methods.desc: Used to define events on this Observable

params.name: object
params.desc: The object with the events defined

methods.name: releaseCapture
methods.desc: Removes all added captures from the Observable.

methods.name: removeListener
methods.desc: Removes a listener

params.name: eventName
params.desc: The type of event to listen for

params.name: scope
params.desc: (optional) The scope (this object) for the handler

methods.name: fireEvent
methods.desc: Fires the specified event with the passed parameters (minus the event name).

params.name: args
params.desc: Variable number of parameters are passed to handlers

methods.name: hasListener
methods.desc: Checks to see if this object has any listeners for a specified event

params.name: eventName
params.desc: The name of the event to check for

methods.name: capture
methods.desc: Starts capture on the specified Observable. All events will be passed to the supplied function with the event name + standard signature of the event before the event is fired. If the supplied function returns false, the event will not fire.

params.name: scope
params.desc: (optional) The scope (this object) for the fn

methods.name: addListener
methods.desc: Appends an event handler to this component

params.name: eventName
params.desc: The type of event to listen for

params.name: scope
params.desc:
(optional) The scope in which to execute the handler
function. The handler function's "this" context.

params.name: options

events.name: *beforepropertychange
events.desc: Fires before a property changes (return false to stop?)

events.name: *propertychange
events.desc: Fires after a property changes

events.name: *validateedit
events.desc:
Fires after a cell is edited, but before the value is set in the record. You can use this to modify the value being set in the field, Return false to cancel the change. The edit event object has the following properties
  • editor - This editor
  • grid - This grid
  • record - The record being edited
  • field - The field name being edited
  • value - The value being set
  • originalValue - The original value for the field, before the edit.
  • row - The grid row index
  • column - The grid column index
  • cancel - Set this to true to cancel the edit or return false from your handler.

params.name: e
params.desc: An edit event (see above for description)

events.name: *beforeedit
events.desc:
Fires before cell editing is triggered. The edit event object has the following properties
  • grid - This grid
  • record - The record being edited
  • field - The field name being edited
  • value - The value for the field being edited.
  • row - The grid row index
  • column - The grid column index
  • cancel - Set this to true to cancel the edit or return false from your handler.

params.name: e
params.desc: An edit event (see above for description)

events.name: *afteredit
events.desc:
Fires after a cell is edited.
  • grid - This grid
  • record - The record being edited
  • field - The field name being edited
  • value - The value being set
  • originalValue - The original value for the field, before the edit.
  • row - The grid row index
  • column - The grid column index

params.name: e
params.desc: An edit event (see above for description)

events.name: *rowcontextmenu
events.desc: Fires when a row is right clicked

events.name: *columnmove
events.desc: Fires when the user moves a column

events.name: *headercontextmenu
events.desc: Fires when a header is right clicked

events.name: *render
events.desc: Fires when the grid is rendered

events.name: *bodyscroll
events.desc: Fires when the body element is scrolled

events.name: *columnresize
events.desc: Fires when the user resizes a column

events.name: *enddrag
events.desc: Fires when a drag operation is complete

events.name: *mouseout
events.desc: The raw mouseout event for the entire grid.

events.name: *cellclick
events.desc: Fires when a cell is clicked

events.name: *dragover
events.desc: Fires while row(s) are being dragged. "targetId" is the id of the Yahoo.util.DD object the selected rows are being dragged over.

events.name: *rowclass
events.desc: Fires when a row is rendered, so you can change add a style to it.

params.name: rowcfg
params.desc: contains record  rowIndex and rowClass - set rowClass to add a style.

events.name: *keydown
events.desc: The raw keydown event for the entire grid.

events.name: *mousedown
events.desc: The raw mousedown event for the entire grid.

events.name: *dragenter
events.desc: Fires when the dragged row(s) first cross another DD target while being dragged

events.name: *dragout
events.desc: Fires when the dragged row(s) leave another DD target while being dragged

events.name: *mouseup
events.desc: The raw mouseup event for the entire grid.

events.name: *keypress
events.desc: The raw keypress event for the entire grid.

events.name: *headerclick
events.desc: Fires when a header is clicked

events.name: *mouseover
events.desc: The raw mouseover event for the entire grid.

events.name: *headerdblclick
events.desc: Fires when a header cell is double clicked

events.name: *dragdrop
events.desc: Fires when dragged row(s) are dropped on a valid DD target

events.name: *rowclick
events.desc: Fires when a row is clicked

events.name: *click
events.desc: The raw click event for the entire grid.

events.name: *rowdblclick
events.desc: Fires when a row is double clicked

events.name: *startdrag
events.desc: Fires when row(s) start being dragged

events.name: *dblclick
events.desc: The raw dblclick event for the entire grid.

events.name: *cellcontextmenu
events.desc: Fires when a cell is right clicked

events.name: *contextmenu
events.desc: The raw contextmenu event for the entire grid.

events.name: *celldblclick
events.desc: Fires when a cell is double clicked
